definitions.definition: used in or connected with surgery

examples.text: a surgical ward *(= for patients having operations)*
They launched **surgical strikes** against enemy targets.
The quarterback found the wide receiver with a pass of almost surgical precision.

wordOrigin: late 18th cent. (earlier as chirurgical): from French cirurgical, from Old French sirurgie, based on Latin chirurgia, from Greek kheirourgia ‘handiwork, surgery’, from kheir ‘hand’ + ergon ‘work’.
